channel.title: MySQL server performance with remote DB?
channel.description:
Say I have a MySQL server (character saving/loading) connecting to a database on my website. My website would be hosted with company A whilst my server would be hosted on a VPS with company B.
Would the performance be terrible? Or has anyone else ran a scenario like this?

item.title: MySQL server performance with remote DB?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Remote databases are fine, it’s usually the database schema itself that takes up a bunch of time. (ie. not using row/table locks, not having the right indexes, etc)

Read full topic
item.source: MySQL server performance with remote DB?

item.title: MySQL server performance with remote DB?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

tobias222:

Thanks for replies. I would probably have the database locally on the vps then connect to it via website. Have the web server take the hit of connecting via Remote SQL.

Working with remote databases is almost always a pain and causes unexplainable issues (sometimes)

Read full topic
item.source: MySQL server performance with remote DB?

item.title: MySQL server performance with remote DB?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Thanks for replies. I would probably have the database locally on the vps then connect to it via website. Have the web server take the hit of connecting via Remote SQL.

item.source: MySQL server performance with remote DB?

item.title: MySQL server performance with remote DB?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

It may be bad for loading because if you have a slow connection with the web server. You cache the player locally so there would be no loading delay and save the player to your db as the player does not need to be logged in for saving as long as the object is active.

Read full topic
item.source: MySQL server performance with remote DB?

item.title: MySQL server performance with remote DB?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

The performance wouldn’t be terrible, it would work and all… But as Atomic suggested, it’d be better to have the SQL ran locally on the VPS. That way it’s an easy connection from server to SQL.

Read full topic
item.source: MySQL server performance with remote DB?

item.title: MySQL server performance with remote DB?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You would be much better off hosting the database locally rather than using your web host provider.

Read full topic
